For the longest time, it was just me and my mom.
I was born and raised in the UK. It's all I know. But before that, my mom lived in a small Czech town with the rest of her family.
I tried asking her about it a few times, but she always dodged the subject. She hardly ever spoke of it.
That only made me more curious about her past, and about where I come from.
I've always been inquisitive. Maybe that's why I became a private investigator back in the UK.
It hasn't been long since my mom passed and I don't really have any other family in the UK.
So, I've decided... It's time!
It's time to visit her hometown… and finally uncover my family's past and my own heritage.
Oh-
I almost forgot - she never taught me much Czech...
But I'm definitely up for the challenge!
Well, here I am... standing at the town square of a small Czech town called Tichovice.
Wow -
It looks so peaceful here...
I can't believe this is really the town my mom grew up in.
This is definitely going to be a trip full of nostalgia... and maybe a little bit of touristy exploration while I'm here.
You glance around, taking it all in. You've wanted to visit this place for the longest time.
You notice an older man standing near the fountain, staring directly at you. He's holding an envelope.
"Pan Novák?"
You nod, slightly confused.
"Tady. Tento dopis je pro Vás." (hover over underlined text to get a hint)
Hmm… I'm pretty sure tady means here. And dopis... something to do with paper. What do you think he just said?
What do you think he just said? (hover over underlined text throughout the game for hints) "Tady. Tento dopis je pro Vás."

Hmm... no, I don't think that's quite right.
What else could it be...?
Oh, yes!
I think he said "Here. This letter is for you."! ("Tady. Tento dopis je pro Vás.")
You just learned some new words! (click the icon above Settings (the icon with the book) to open your Journal. All your learned words will be there if you need to revisit them.)
He hands you the envelope he was holding.
You look down at your hands and turn over the envelope. You notice your full name handwritten in cursive on it.
"Tobiáš Novák"
It also has a return address on it and the name "Růžena Nováková".
You vaguely remember hearing this name once or twice in your childhood. Was it your mother's... cousin? Or maybe her mom?
You can't quite remember...
You realize you've been staring at the envelope for some time and so you look up to talk with the man who handed it to you just to see he's gone, nowhere to be seen.
Oh?
You look back down and open the envelope.
Inside is a handwritten letter -
Well, let's see how much I can decipher...
Milý Tobiáši, ... Dear, Tobiáš - duh
Pokud čteš tento dopis, pak jsi skutečně přijel. ... Something about me reading this letter...

Já a tvoje máma jsme si byly vždycky velmi blízké. Lituji toho, že tajemnství a spousta let co jsme byly od sebe nás rozdělily a nezůstali jsme jedna rodina. ... Oh, something about my mom. I think - secrets and... years? Years of secrets?! And the last word definitely means family!

Musím ti říct něco důležitého. Z našeho domu zmizel náhrdelník. Je to rodinný klenot, který nám předala tvoje babička. ... She want to tell me something about... somehting to do with family. Oh and I'm pretty sure the last word means grandmother?

Ostatní tvrdí, že se jen ztratil, ale já tomu nevěřím. Už jsem příliš stará a unavená na rodinné hádky. Ale ty, člověk zvenčí, ale zároveň z rodiny, bys mi možná mohl pomoci zjistit pravdu. ... All I can tell from these lines is family, human? and the truth?

Nikomu jsem o tomto dopise neřekla. Doufám, že za mnou přijdeš co nejdřív. Najdeš mě v rodinné vile Novákových. ... Something about the letter again and I think she's telling me to visit her at the Novák's villa?
S láskou, Teta Růžena ... With love... Oh! - aunt Růžena!
Well, I wanted to look around this town square some more (I still could, just a bit) but I think my next stop is obvious - the Novák's villa!
